text: An election to Longford County Council took place on 27 June 1991 as part of that year's Irish local elections. 21 councillors were elected from four electoral divisions by PR-STV voting for an eight-year term of office. ==Results by party== {| class=wikitable ! colspan=2 align=center|Party ! valign=top|Seats ! valign=top|± ! valign=top|First Pref. votes ! valign=top|FPv% ! valign=top|±% |- | align=right|9 | align=right|- | align=right|5,391 | align=right|37.32% | align=right| |- | align=right|8 | align=right|-1 | align=right|5,544 | align=right|38.37% | align=right| |- | align=right|1 | align=right|+1 | align=right|536 | align=right|3.71% | align=right| |- | align=right|3 | align=right|+1 | align=right|2,158 | align=right|14.94% | align=right| |- | align=right|0 | align=right|-1 | align=right|- | align=right|- | align=right| |- | colspan=2 align=center|Totals | align=right |21 | align=center|- | align=right |14,447 | align=center|100% | align=center|— |} ==Results by Electoral Area== ===Ballinalee=== ===Ballymahon=== ===Drumlish=== ===Granard=== ===Longford=== ==External links== * Official website * irishelectionliterature Category:1991 Irish local elections 1991
title: 1991 Longford County Council election
